meanings.definition: The act of preventing or hindering something from happening.
meanings.sent1: The forestallment of the rain by carrying an umbrella kept me dry.
meanings.sent2: She made a forestallment by locking the door to prevent any intruders.
meanings.sent3: The forestallment of the cat from catching the mouse led to a comical chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking was a forestallment that stopped the argument from escalating into a full-blown fight.
meanings.sent5: The forestallment of the car crash by slamming on the brakes saved us from a serious accident.

meanings.definition: A measure taken to prevent or hinder something from happening.
meanings.sent1: The forestallment of the thief by installing security cameras was effective.
meanings.sent2: The forestallment of a fire by having smoke detectors is crucial for safety.
meanings.sent3: The forestallment of the cookie jar from the kids required placing it out of reach on a high shelf.
meanings.sent4: Her forestallment of overspending involved setting a strict budget.
meanings.sent5: The forestallment of a power outage with a generator kept the house running smoothly.
